com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class DefaultScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.AbstractScheduler
      • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.DefaultScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer

    public class DefaultScheduler
extends AbstractScheduler
implements Observer
    This scheduler when provided with a ServiceSpec will deploy the service and recover from encountered faults when possible. Changes to the ServiceSpec will result in rolling configuration updates, or the creation of new Tasks where applicable.

    • Method Detail

      • newBuilder

        public static DefaultScheduler.Builder newBuilder(ServiceSpec serviceSpec,
                                                  SchedulerFlags schedulerFlags)
        Creates a new DefaultScheduler.Builder based on the provided ServiceSpec describing the service, including details such as the service name, the pods/tasks to be deployed, and the plans describing how the deployment should be organized.

      • createStateStore

        public static StateStore createStateStore(ServiceSpec serviceSpec,
                                          SchedulerFlags schedulerFlags)
        Creates and returns a new default StateStore suitable for passing to DefaultScheduler.Builder. To avoid the risk of zookeeper consistency issues, the returned storage MUST NOT be written to before the Scheduler has registered with Mesos, as signified by a call to AbstractScheduler.registered(SchedulerDriver, Protos.FrameworkID, Protos.MasterInfo)

      • createConfigStore

        public static ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> createConfigStore(ServiceSpec serviceSpec,
                                                         java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> customDeserializationSubtypes)
                                                  throws ConfigStoreException
        Creates and returns a new default ConfigStore suitable for passing to DefaultScheduler.Builder. To avoid the risk of zookeeper consistency issues, the returned storage MUST NOT be written to before the Scheduler has registered with Mesos, as signified by a call to AbstractScheduler.registered(SchedulerDriver, Protos.FrameworkID, Protos.MasterInfo).
        Parameters:
        customDeserializationSubtypes - custom subtypes to register for deserialization of DefaultServiceSpec, mainly useful for deserializing custom implementations of PlacementRules
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if validating serialization of the config fails, e.g. due to an unrecognized deserialization type

      • createConfigStore

        static ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> createConfigStore(ServiceSpec serviceSpec,
                                                  java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> customDeserializationSubtypes,
                                                  Persister persister)
                                           throws ConfigStoreException
        Version of createConfigStore(ServiceSpec, Collection) which allows passing a custom Persister object. Exposed for unit tests.
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException

      • defaultConfigValidators

        public static java.util.List<ConfigValidator<ServiceSpec>> defaultConfigValidators()
        Returns the default configuration validators: - Task sets cannot shrink (each set's task count must stay the same or increase). - Task volumes cannot be changed.

        This function may be used to get the default validators and add more to the list when constructing the DefaultScheduler.

      • updateConfig

        public static ConfigurationUpdater.UpdateResult updateConfig(ServiceSpec serviceSpec,
                                                             StateStore stateStore,
                                                             ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> configStore,
                                                             java.util.Collection<ConfigValidator<ServiceSpec>> configValidators)
        Updates the configuration target to reflect the provided serviceSpec using the provided configValidators, or stays with the previous configuration if there were validation errors.
        Parameters:
        serviceSpec - the service specification to use
        stateStore - the state store to pass to the updater
        configStore - the config store to pass to the updater
        configValidators - the list of config validators, see defaultConfigValidators() for reasonable defaults
        Returns:
        the config update result, which may contain one or more validation errors produced by configValidators
